أبريل: April (fourth month of the Gregorian calendar)
أبونا: genitive construct state of أَب (ʔab, “father”) + ـنَا • (-nā) (enclitic form of نَحْنُ (naḥnu)): “our father”
أثفية: hobstone, one of three stones (or two stones and a mountain) around a fire serving as a tripod to support a cookpot
أثناء: plural of ثِنْي (ṯiny, “duplication; a single repetition of a thing; time”)
أربيل: Arbil (a city in Iraqi Kurdistan, Iraq)
أركون: one of the principal and fundamental elements or hypostases that keep together the material world or a personification thereof, archon
أريحا: Jericho (a city in the West Bank, Palestine)
أسيوط: Asyut (a city, the capital city of Asyut governorate, Egypt)
أشغال: plural of شُغْل (šuḡl): works, occupations, etc.
أضحية: sacrifice, something ritually offered for consumption
أعيان: A person holding high office; VIP; eminent, noted personage
أغسطس: August (eighth month of the Gregorian calendar)
أفنان: plural of فَنَن (fanan, “branch, twig (of a tree)”)
أفندي: honorific address on an adult male; mister, sir, efendi
أكسدة: verbal noun of أَكْسَدَ (ʔaksada) (form Iq): oxidation
ألفين: a transliteration of the English male given name Alvin
أمومة: verbal noun of أَمَّ (ʔamma, “to be a mother”) (form I)
أنتما: you, ye (masculine or feminine dual subject pronoun)
أنقرة: Ankara (the capital city and province of Turkey)
أوقية: awqiyyah (ounce), a unit of weight in Egypt: 37 grams (one twelfth ratl)
أيتها: O, oh: form of أَيُّهَا (ʔayyuhā) used when addressing females or feminine collective nouns
أيلول: September (ninth month of the Gregorian and Julian calendars)
إبهام: verbal noun of أَبْهَمَ (ʔabhama, “to make obscure”) (form IV)
إجلاء: verbal noun of أَجْلَى (ʔajlā, “to evacuate”) (form IV): evacuation
إخلاء: verbal noun of أَخْلَى (ʔaḵlā, “to evacuate”) (form IV)
إخلاص: sincere devotion, loyal attachment, sincere affection
إدريس: Idris, Idrees, a figure in the Islamic narrative.
إرشاد: verbal noun of أَرْشَدَ (ʔaršada, “to guide, to cause to follow the right course”) (form IV)
إسفين: wedge (in many senses, including in wedge-writing and as a simple machine)
إشاعة: verbal noun of أَشَاعَ (ʔašāʕa, “to spread, publish, make known”) (form IV)
إصابة: verbal noun of أَصَابَ (ʔaṣāba, “to hit the target, to injure”) (form IV)
إطفاء: verbal noun of أَطْفَأَ (ʔaṭfaʔa, “to extinguish”) (form IV)
إغفال: verbal noun of أَغْفَلَ (ʔaḡfala, “to neglect, to overlook”) (form IV)
إفراد: verbal noun of أَفْرَدَ (ʔafrada) (form IV): singling out
إفلاس: verbal noun of أَفْلَسَ (ʔaflasa) (form IV), bankruptcy
إقليم: region, climate (geographical area of the earth, particularly a zone of latitude)
إمالة: The pronunciation of the vowel /a/ or /aː/ so that it is raised towards
إمساك: verbal noun of أَمْسَكَ (ʔamsaka) (form IV) holding (something)
إملاء: verbal noun of أَمْلَى (ʔamlā, “to dictate”) (form IV)
إنفاق: verbal noun of أَنْفَقَ (ʔanfaqa) (form IV): spending
إيران: Iran (a country in West Asia in the Middle East)
إيفاء: verbal noun of أَوْفَى (ʔawfā, “to fulfill a compact, pay the whole of”) (form IV).
إيلاء: verbal noun of أَوْلَى (ʔawlā) (form IV) from the root و ل ي (w l y)

إيوان: portico, vestibule, vaulted entrance, porch, arcade-yard

تناثر: to become dispersed, to become dissipated, to become scattered
تناحر: to conflict with, compete against, kill each other, to engage in a wrangle, to quarrel

تناصر: to assist or support each other, to help each other out
تناقش: verbal noun of تَنَاقَشَ (tanāqaša, “to argue”) (form VI)
تناول: verbal noun of تَنَاوَلَ (tanāwala) (form V): taking of food; making contact
تنظيم: organization, the act of putting in order
تنوين: verbal noun of نَوَّنَ (nawwana, “to add nunation”) (form II)
تهافت: to scramble, to press into or upon, to throng, to scour, to flock, to descend
تهامة: Tihamah, which is the climatic region at the Red Sea coast of the Arabian Peninsula

توافد: to arrive in crowds, to flock
توبال: flakes, what falls off from copper or iron or another metal due to it being hammered – that of copper yore was mixed into hydromel against phlegm, that of iron used in eye remedies and against ulcers
توحيد: verbal noun of وَحَّدَ (waḥḥada, “to unify, to connect, to combine, to profess the unity of”) (form II)
توريث: making someone an heir to another
توفيق: verbal noun of وَفَّقَ (waffaqa, “to fit, to accommodate, to reconcile, grant success”) (form II)
تولوز: Toulouse (the capital city of Haute-Garonne department and of the larger Occitania region, France)
تومان: toman (informal currency of Iran, equivalent to ten rials)
تونسي: Tunisian (of, from or relating to Tunisia)
تيمور: Timur, Tamerlane (1336–1405), Turco-Mongol conqueror and founder of the Timurid Empire.
ثنتان: nominative feminine of اِثْنَان (iṯnān, “two”); alternative form of اِثْنَتَان (iṯnatān)
جازون: turf, lawn, rare spelling of كَازُون (kāzūn)
جانرك: gage, Prunus domestica subsp. italica (fruit and tree)
جذريا: from or belonging to the root
جلباب: a long, loose-fitting outer garment; a robe

جلنار: wild pomegranate (Punica granatum); its flowers or wood
جنرال: general (officer in any general rank, such as a brigadier general, major general, lieutenant general, etc.)
جهالة: verbal noun of جَهِلَ (jahila, “to be ignorant, be stupid”) (form I)
جوابا: as an answer, in reply to
حادثة: a thing that springs up or happens
حاسبة: ellipsis of آلَة حَاسِبَة (ʔāla ḥāsiba): calculator (mechanical or electronic device that performs mathematical calculations)
حالما: as soon as, the moment that, right after, on, just at, no sooner than, immediately after
حبالة: snare, a net or other tied or tying thing by which one catches
حبقوق: Habakkuk (a Jewish prophet of the Old Testament; author of the book that bears his name)

حجازي: a surname, Hegazy, Hejazy, Hegazi, Hejazi, Higazy, Hijazy, Higazi, or Hijazi
حدوتة: fairy tale, a story told to children
حذلقة: pedantry, excessive concern over minuscule or relatively unimportant details
حسبما: according to, from what, depending on
حصالة: money box, piggy bank, swear pot
حلاوة: verbal noun of حَلَا (ḥalā, “to be sweet”) (form I)

حمالة: gurney, stretcher (portable bed for medical transport)
حمامة: singulative of حَمَام (ḥamām): a dove, a pigeon
حمودة: a diminutive of the male given names أَحْمَد (ʔaḥmad) or مُحَمَّد (muḥammad)
حوارى: a kind of white bran-less but gluten-full flour of common wheat (Triticum aestivum)
حوجلة: flask, vial (where the lower part is broader than the upper)

حوصلة: stomach of a bird, craw, crop, gizzard
حيثية: view, viewpoint, point of view, standpoint, position
خاتمة: the last part of a thing
خاصية: a feature, a special quality, a property
خبيئة: hidden thing or place where something is hidden, stash, cache, treasure/treasury, underbelly
خرطوم: trunk (of an elephant), snout, muzzle, nose
خزانة: an enclosed storage serving as furniture, depository: cupboard, wardrobe; closet; safe, coffer, vault; a niche in a wall, a glove box in a car and a safe-deposit box in a bank.

خطيئة: sin, offense, fault, act of disobedience for which one deserves punishment
خلابة: verbal noun of خَلَبَ (ḵalaba, “to fascinate”) (form I)
خلاصة: synopsis, synthesis, essence, quintessence, gist, abstract, résumé etc.
خلالة: what comes forth or falls behind when something is perforated or picked, so after toothpicking, or dates left in the roots of branches when the racemes have been collected
خليجي: someone from one of the Arab states of the Persian Gulf, khaleeji
خليقة: an inherited or generally innate behavior, disposition, inclination, or manner of conduct, a part of a person's nature or grain, a predisposition
خميني: a transliteration of the Persian surname خمینی (xomeyni)
داعية: advocate, promoter, proponent: someone who advocates or calls for a certain cause, religion, belief, ideology, or action.
دجنبر: Maghreb form of دِيسَمْبَر (dīsambar): December (twelfth month of the Gregorian calendar)
دراعة: a kind of wide and loose gown, a turtleneck
دسامة: greasiness, the state of having much fat on oneself

دمياط: Damietta (a port city in northern Egypt)
دواسة: pedal, the mechanical implement to propel a means of transportation or other device by force of the feet

ديفيد: a male given name, equivalent to English David
راحيل: a female given name, equivalent to English Rachel

رجاحة: forbearance, clemency, gravity of intellect, level-headedness, sobriety

روبرت: a male given name from English
روسيا: Russia (a transcontinental country in Eastern Europe and North Asia)
روسية: a people inhabiting northeast Europe in the Middle Ages often presumed to be of Scandinavian stock

زعرور: thornapple, medlar (Crataegus gen. et spp., fruit and tree)

مسطار: bevel, trowel, and similar handicraft tools for ensuring evenness of what is built
مسطول: drugged, high, wasted, drunk (under the psychological effects of a mood-affecting drug)
مسقام: sickly (of a person who gets sick a lot)
مسقعة: moussaka (a dish consisting of layers of minced lamb or beef, sliced aubergine (eggplant) or potatoes, tomatoes and béchamel sauce, baked in the oven)
مسكوت: what is not said, non-dit (almost always used with the preposition عَن (ʕan))
مسمار: nail, pin, peg, wedge, bolt, even a screw
مسودة: draft (an early version of a written work)
مشاية: carpet to walk upon such as a doormat, runner
مشحون: loaded with, charged with, full of
مشرحة: morgue, where dissected deads are inspected
مشعوذ: wizard, warlock, hexer (someone who claims to have supernatural powers to deceive people)
مشملة: medlar, azarole, loquat and what looks like it of fruits and fruit-trees
مشوار: errand, a promenade, walk or ride
مشيمة: a sac that encloses the embryo or the fetus during gestation, the amnion or the chorion, the fetal membrane
مصراع: shutter or wing of a door
مصطكى: mastic, the gum-resin of Pistacia lentiscus
مضمدة: yoke, a frame around the neck of beasts to pull a plough
مطبعة: printery, printing press, print shop, any place that prints
مطحنة: mill (the place where a miller works)
مطفحة: slotted spoon, skimming ladle, a spoon to catch what overflows
معراض: an indirect and purposely ambiguous statement which suggests an untruth to the listener, but is not technically a lie
معصفر: a piece of clothing dyed by safflower
معطاء: inclined to give, giving freely, generous
معطوف: bent, deflected from a straight line
معمول: a word whose grammatical state is governed by another word
معيار: standard measure, standard, gauge (of measures and weights)
مغموم: grieved, caused to mourn or lament or be sorrowful
مغنية: Maghnia (a city in Tlemcen province, Algeria)
مغوار: raider, ranger, knight, dauntless fighter, commando
مفروغ: passive participle of فَرَغَ or فَرِغَ (faraḡa or fariḡa).
مقابل: in return for, in exchange for, as a compensation for
مقاتل: active participle of قَاتَلَ (qātala): fighter, combatant, warrior
مقتطف: anthology, collectanea, extracts (especially with the plural form)
مكبوت: suppressed, repressed, inhibited, bridled, curbed, contained
مكيال: measure, what is used for meting
ملائم: active participle of لَاءَمَ (lāʔama): fit, proper, convenient
ملبوس: an article of clothing; a garment, what is worn (plural form is more common and means clothes)
ملحمة: a place where meat is stored or sold; butcher's shop, meathouse
ملفوظ: thrown down, cast away, ejected, expelled, discharged
مناجذ: plural of خُلْد (ḵuld): mole-rats (animals) or moles (animals, modern)
منبثق: emergent, gushing out (of water, a river, etc)
منبطح: flat on the face, lying face down, prostate
منتدى: place whither the people are called together, gathering place, meeting location, forum, assembly
منتقم: active participle of اِنْتَقَمَ (intaqama, “to take revenge”)
منحوت: carved, sculptured, sculpted, chiseled (from stone or wood)
منزوع: torn out, plucked out, taken off
منصوص: attributed to its author or source
منطاد: balloon (inflatable object to transport people through the air)
منظار: magnifying glass, telescope or other -scope, monocular as well as binoculars
منقوش: engraved, incised, inscribed, chased, sculptured, chiseled, carved
منيرة: Munira, a female given name, "luminous, bright, shining"
مهانة: verbal noun of هَانَ (hāna) (form I): humiliation, lowliness, abjectness
مهموس: unvoiced, voiceless a speech sound produced without vibration of the vocal folds
موقوت: having a fixed time or duration, timed
ميثرة: a kind of shabrack or saddle-pillow made of silk, or other silk blankets
ميجار: club to play with a ball, racquet etc.
ميراث: inheritance, the property conceived by the law of succession
ميشال: a female given name of French origin
ميضأة: a place or tank for cleaning oneself
نابلس: Nablus (a city and governorate of the West Bank, Palestine)
ناديا: a female given name, equivalent to English Nadia
نادين: a female given name, equivalent to English Nadine
ناطور: somebody who watches over things, watchman, lookout, caretaker, concierge, storage room guy, warden, janitor, etc.
نافذة: opening in a wall, air hole
ناموس: namus, mos sive fas – one of the notoriously hard to define terms like morals or conscience
نانسي: Nancy (the capital city of Meurthe-et-Moselle department, France)
نباهة: verbal noun of نَبُهَ (nabuha) (form I) and نَبِهَ (nabiha).
نجران: a horizontal piece of wood serving as the foot or sill of a door upon which it turns
نحميا: Nehemiah (the sixteenth book of the Old Testament of the Bible, and a book of the Tanakh)
نخالة: siftings, what is shed after clearing
نسناس: nasnas, a creation related to the jinn
نصيري: an Alawite, a member of a syncretic Shia sect concentrated in Latakia and Tartus governorates in Syria
نعيما: said to the person who has shaved, got a haircut, took a bath, shower etc
نفاسة: verbal noun of نَفُسَ (nafusa) (form I) preciousness, the quality of being valuable (especially of precious metals)
نقيصة: defect, fault, shortcoming, demerit, imperfection, defectiveness
نوروز: Nowruz (New Year in the Iranian/Zoroastrian calendar, celebrated on the spring equinox)
نونبر: Maghreb form of نُوفِمْبَر (nūfimbar): November (eleventh month of the Gregorian calendar)
نياحة: lamentation, wailing, loud beweeping of a deceased
نيبال: Nepal (a country in South Asia, located between China and India)
نيبور: Nippur (an ancient city in Sumer, modern Nuffar in Afak Al-Qādisiyyah Governorate, Iraq)
نيسان: April (Solar calendar used in Palestine, Syria, Lebanon, Jordan, and Iraq)
هاشمي: Hashemite, relating to the house of Hashim
هاواي: Hawaii (an insular state of the United States, formerly a territory)
هجليج: Balanites gen. et spp. and their fruits
هجينة: female equivalent of هَجِين (hajīn, “hybrid, half-breed, mongrel”)
هريسة: mush, mash, kasha, puree, jumble, ground foodstuff
هيهات: it is far; it is impossible; no way
واردة: one who descends, especially to a watering place
وحيدا: indefinite masculine accusative singular of وَحِيد (waḥīd)
وزارة: the office, responsibility, or burden of a minister, a ministry
وزاري: ministerial (related to a governmental minister or ministry)
وسوسة: verbal noun of وَسْوَسَ (waswasa, “to whisper, disquiet, suggest wicked things”) (form Iq)
وهابي: Wahhabi, Wahhabist, Wahhabite, an adherent of Wahhabism
يأجوج: Gog (an evil tribe associated with Magog)
يابسة: earth, land, surface, sand, mud; as opposed to water
يحبور: the young of a bustard (وَلَد الْحُبَارَى (walad al-ḥubārā))
يسوعي: Jesuit, a member of the Society of Jesus
يعقوب: Jacob, Hebrew patriarch also known as Israel
يقطين: a variety of squash or gourd
يقينا: certainly, surely, for sure, assuredly, for certain, for a fact
يناير: January (first month of the Gregorian calendar)
يوحنا: Any of the New Testament figures named John
يوليو: July (seventh month of the Gregorian calendar)
يونيو: June (sixth month of the Gregorian calendar)
